summary: This is a standardized plea waiver form from the Circuit Court of the Fifteenth Judicial Circuit in Palm Beach County, Florida. The form outlines the rights a defendant waives when entering a plea, including the right to a trial, to confront witnesses, to testify, and to appeal. It includes signature lines for the defendant and defense attorney, but no specific names, charges, or case details are filled in on this blank form.

locations.name: Palm Beach County, Florida
locations.context: Location of the Circuit Court handling the case

keyFacts: This is a generic, unfilled plea waiver form (Form 002) from Palm Beach County Circuit Court.
The form is designed for a defendant to waive constitutional rights including trial by jury, confrontation of witnesses, and the right against self-incrimination.
The form references a case number field but it is not populated, and no defendant or attorney names are entered.
The document is part of the Epstein case document release but contains no case-specific information about Epstein or any co-defendants.
The form includes a note that a plea may subject a non-U.S. citizen to deportation.
